alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Lower Yampa River Basin; Upper Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 05 at 2:01AM MDT until May 05 at 11:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases may cause the river flows to become high. Possible minor flooding downstream from the dam. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Yampa River Basin of northwest Colorado, including the main stem of the Yampa River and associated tributaries across Routt and Moffat Counties. * WHEN...Through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - High runoff from snowmelt. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central Yampa River Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Lower Yampa River Basin; Upper Yampa River Basin
